info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 11:28PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN LUZERNE COUNTY THROUGH 1215 AM EDT... At 1127 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Drifton, or near Hazleton, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Hazleton, West Hazleton, Freeland, Bear Creek, Conyngham, White Haven, Penn Lake Park, Bear Creek Village, Jeddo, and Drifton. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 80 between 262 and 273. Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 143 and 155. Interstate 476 near 105. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
